publication.abstract: Summary: pyDockWEB is a web server for the rigid-body docking prediction of protein-protein complex structures using a new version of the pyDock scoring algorithm. We use here a new custom parallel FTDock implementation, with adjusted grid size for optimal FFT calculations, and a new version of pyDock, which dramatically speeds up calculations while keeping the same predictive accuracy. Given the 3D coordinates of two interacting proteins, pyDockWEB returns the best docking orientations as scored mainly by electrostatics and desolvation energy. © The Author 2013.
publication.title: pyDockWEB: A web server for rigid-body protein-protein docking using electrostatics and desolvation scoring

summary.description: Web server for the structural prediction of protein-protein interactions. Given the 3D coordinates of two interacting proteins, it returns the best rigid-body docking orientations generated by FTDock (Gabb HA. et al. J Mol Biol 1997;272:106-120) and evaluated by pyDock scoring function (Cheng et al. 2007 Proteins 68, 503-515), which includes electrostatics, desolvation energy and limited van der Waals contribution.
summary.name: pyDockWEB
